sites.name: Ještěd Tower
sites.description: This iconic hyperboloid tower and ski hotel, designed by architect Karel Hubáček, sits atop Ještěd Mountain at 1,012 meters above sea level. A UNESCO-protected architectural gem, it offers panoramic views of northern Bohemia and serves as both a television transmitter and unique hotel. The futuristic design from the 1960s has made it a symbol of Liberec and one of the most recognizable landmarks in the Czech Republic.
sites.seasonal_notes: Clear days offer the best panoramic views. Winter provides skiing opportunities, while summer is perfect for hiking. The cable car operates year-round but may be closed during severe weather.
sites.booking_tips: Take the cable car from Liberec or drive up the mountain road. The restaurant requires reservations, especially for dinner. Hotel stays should be booked well in advance due to limited rooms.

sites.name: Liberec Zoo
sites.description: One of the oldest zoos in the Czech Republic, founded in 1904, Liberec Zoo is renowned for its conservation efforts and diverse collection of animals from around the world. The zoo spans 13 hectares and is home to over 170 species, including rare white tigers, Amur leopards, and various endangered species. The zoo's commitment to breeding programs and species conservation has earned it international recognition.
sites.seasonal_notes: Animals are most active in cooler morning hours. Spring and summer offer the best experience with outdoor exhibits fully operational. Some indoor tropical pavilions provide year-round attractions.
sites.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online for discounts. Allow at least half a day to see all exhibits. The zoo offers guided tours and special feeding sessions that can be booked in advance.

sites.name: Liberec Town Hall
sites.description: This magnificent Neo-Renaissance town hall, built between 1888-1893, is considered one of the most beautiful town halls in Central Europe. Designed by Viennese architect Franz von Neumann, it features a striking 65-meter tower and elaborate facade decorations. The building houses the city administration and offers guided tours showcasing its ornate interior, including the ceremonial hall with beautiful frescoes and stained glass windows.
sites.seasonal_notes: Guided tours are available year-round. The tower offers excellent views but requires climbing stairs. Summer weddings often take place in the ceremonial hall.
sites.booking_tips: Tours must be booked in advance through the tourist information center. Tower visits may be limited during official city events. Photography inside requires special permission.

sites.name: Botanical Garden Liberec
sites.description: Established in 1895, this botanical garden spans 3 hectares and features over 8,000 plant species from around the world. The garden includes nine tropical and subtropical greenhouses, an alpine garden, and themed outdoor sections. Notable collections include orchids, cacti, carnivorous plants, and a impressive butterfly house. The garden serves both educational and research purposes while providing a peaceful retreat in the city center.
sites.seasonal_notes: Greenhouses provide year-round attractions, while outdoor gardens are most beautiful from spring to autumn. The butterfly house is particularly popular with children and operates with tropical temperatures year-round.
sites.booking_tips: No advance booking required for general admission. Special exhibitions and events may require separate tickets. The garden offers educational programs for groups that should be booked in advance.

sites.name: Regional Gallery Liberec
sites.description: Housed in a beautiful Art Nouveau building from 1898, the Regional Gallery showcases an impressive collection of Czech and European art from the 16th to 21st centuries. The gallery features works by prominent Czech artists, temporary exhibitions, and a notable collection of glass art reflecting the region's glassmaking tradition. The building itself is an architectural gem with ornate decorations and period interiors.
sites.seasonal_notes: The gallery hosts rotating temporary exhibitions throughout the year. Summer months often feature special outdoor installations in the surrounding park. Workshops and lectures are regularly organized.
sites.booking_tips: Check the website for current exhibitions and events. Group tours can be arranged in advance. The gallery shop offers unique glass art pieces and local crafts.

sites.name: Liberec Castle
sites.description: Originally built in the 16th century and later reconstructed in Neo-Renaissance style, Liberec Castle serves as a cultural center and museum. The castle houses the Regional Museum with collections focusing on local history, decorative arts, and the region's industrial heritage, particularly textile production. The castle's park provides a pleasant setting for walks and cultural events throughout the year.
sites.seasonal_notes: The museum is open year-round with rotating exhibitions. Summer concerts and cultural events are held in the castle courtyard and park. Winter months offer a more intimate museum experience.
sites.booking_tips: Standard museum admission allows access to permanent collections. Special exhibitions may require separate tickets. Guided tours of the castle's history can be arranged for groups.

sites.name: Aquapark Babylon
sites.description: Part of the large Babylon Liberec entertainment complex, this aquapark features multiple pools, water slides, wellness facilities, and a tropical environment maintained year-round. The complex also includes the Babylon Center with shopping, dining, and entertainment options, making it a popular destination for families and relaxation seekers.
sites.seasonal_notes: Operating year-round with consistent tropical temperatures. Summer weekends can be crowded with families. Weekday visits offer a more relaxed experience.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets often provide discounts. Day passes include access to all aquapark facilities. Combination tickets with other Babylon Center attractions are available.

sites.name: North Bohemian Museum
sites.description: The largest museum in the Liberec region, showcasing comprehensive collections of natural history, regional history, and decorative arts. The museum features impressive displays of minerals and fossils, ethnographic collections, and exhibitions on the region's textile industry heritage. Special attention is given to the area's glassmaking tradition and folk culture.
sites.seasonal_notes: The museum operates year-round with changing temporary exhibitions. Family-friendly programs and workshops are regularly scheduled. Winter months provide focused time for detailed exploration of collections.
sites.booking_tips: Standard admission covers all permanent exhibitions. Audio guides are available in multiple languages. School groups and educational programs should be booked in advance.

sites.name: F. X. Šalda Theatre
sites.description: Named after the famous Czech critic F. X. Šalda, this regional theatre is an important cultural institution in Liberec. Built in the early 20th century, the theatre presents a diverse repertoire including drama, opera, and ballet. The building features beautiful period architecture and an intimate auditorium that creates a special atmosphere for performances.
sites.seasonal_notes: The theatre season typically runs from September to June. Summer may feature outdoor performances or guest productions. Advance booking is essential for popular shows.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets can be purchased online or at the box office. Popular performances sell out quickly. Student and senior discounts are available. Programs are typically in Czech, but some international productions are offered.

sites.name: Liberec Main Square
sites.description: The historic heart of Liberec, this triangular square is surrounded by beautiful 19th and early 20th-century architecture, including the impressive Town Hall, regional library, and various merchant houses. The square serves as the main gathering place for festivals, markets, and cultural events. The mix of architectural styles reflects the city's rich history as a textile industry center.
sites.seasonal_notes: Christmas markets transform the square in December. Summer outdoor cafes and restaurants extend into the square. Spring and autumn offer pleasant weather for walking and photography.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general visits. The square hosts various events throughout the year - check local calendars. Surrounding cafes and restaurants provide excellent viewing points.

sites.name: Liberec-Rochlice Ski Resort
sites.description: A local ski area offering slopes for various skill levels, situated on the slopes of Ještěd Mountain. While smaller than major Alpine resorts, it provides accessible winter sports opportunities with well-maintained slopes, ski rentals, and lessons. The resort offers beautiful views of the surrounding Bohemian landscape and is popular with local families and beginners.
sites.seasonal_notes: Operating from December to March, weather dependent. Artificial snow-making extends the season. Weekends can be crowded with local skiers. Cross-country skiing trails are also available.
sites.booking_tips: Day passes can be purchased on-site or online. Ski equipment rental is available at the base. Ski lessons should be booked in advance, especially for children's programs.

sites.name: Wallenstein Gardens
sites.description: A peaceful urban park in the city center, featuring walking paths, mature trees, and seasonal flower displays. The park provides a green oasis for relaxation and recreation, with benches, playgrounds for children, and open spaces for outdoor activities. It's a popular spot for locals to enjoy nature without leaving the city.
sites.seasonal_notes: Spring brings beautiful blooming flowers and trees. Summer provides shade and cool walking paths. Autumn colors make for scenic photography. Winter walks are possible but paths may be icy.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. The park is accessible 24 hours. Perfect for jogging, walking, or family picnics. Nearby cafes provide refreshments.

activities.name: Ještěd Mountain Hiking
activities.description: Explore the scenic hiking trails on Ještěd Mountain as the snow melts and spring flowers begin to bloom. The mountain offers spectacular views of northern Bohemia and the Jizera Mountains.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring brings mild temperatures and beautiful wildflowers, making it perfect for mountain hiking. The trails are less crowded than summer.
activities.booking_tips: Check weather conditions before hiking and bring appropriate gear. The cable car operates year-round for easy access.

activities.name: Liberec Zoo Spring Visit
activities.description: Visit Liberec Zoo during spring when animals are most active and baby animals are born. The zoo features over 170 species including rare white tigers and Amur leopards.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring is ideal for zoo visits as animals are more active in cooler temperatures and many species have newborns.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online for discounts and arrive early to see animals during their most active hours.

activities.name: Harcov Reservoir Walks
activities.description: Enjoy peaceful walks around the Harcov Dam reservoir as the surrounding trees and flowers come to life. The area offers beautiful lakeside views and mountain scenery.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring brings fresh greenery and blooming flowers around the reservoir, creating a picturesque setting for walks.
activities.booking_tips: Combine with a visit to Rybářská bašta restaurant for lakeside dining with mountain views.

activities.name: Botanical Garden Spring Bloom
activities.description: Explore the Liberec Botanical Garden as spring flowers bloom in the outdoor sections. The garden features over 8,000 plant species with beautiful spring displays.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring is the best time to see the outdoor gardens in bloom, while the greenhouses provide year-round attractions.
activities.booking_tips: Visit early morning for the best light and fewer crowds. Don't miss the butterfly house which operates year-round.

activities.name: Easter Markets in Old Town
activities.description: Experience traditional Czech Easter markets in Liberec's Old Town Square, featuring local crafts, Easter decorations, and seasonal treats like mazanec (Easter bread).
activities.seasonal_notes: Easter markets are a cherished Czech tradition, typically held in the weeks leading up to Easter Sunday.
activities.booking_tips: Visit on weekends for the most vendors and festive atmosphere. Try traditional Easter foods like decorated eggs and sweet pastries.

activities.name: Cable Car to Ještěd Tower
activities.description: Take the scenic cable car ride to the iconic Ještěd Tower for panoramic views of the spring landscape. The tower offers dining and observation decks.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring offers clear views of the surrounding mountains and valleys as the landscape awakens from winter.
activities.booking_tips: Book restaurant reservations in advance if planning to dine at the tower. Check weather for best visibility.

activities.name: Regional Gallery Spring Exhibitions
activities.description: Visit the Regional Gallery in its beautiful Art Nouveau building to see spring exhibitions and the impressive collection of Czech and European art.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring exhibitions often feature local artists and seasonal themes, making it a perfect indoor activity during unpredictable weather.
activities.booking_tips: Check the gallery's website for current exhibitions and special events. The building itself is an architectural gem.

activities.name: Liberec Castle Park Walk
activities.description: Stroll through the peaceful castle park as spring flowers bloom and the historic Liberec Castle serves as a cultural center with rotating exhibitions.
activities.seasonal_notes: The castle park is particularly beautiful in spring with blooming trees and flowers, offering a peaceful retreat in the city center.
activities.booking_tips: Combine with a visit to the castle's Regional Museum for a full cultural experience.

activities.name: Aquapark Babylon
activities.description: Cool off at the indoor Aquapark Babylon with multiple pools, water slides, and tropical environment. The complex also includes shopping and entertainment options.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer is perfect for water park visits, though the indoor facility operates year-round with consistent tropical temperatures.
activities.booking_tips: Visit on weekdays to avoid weekend crowds. Online tickets often provide discounts.

activities.description: Enjoy summer activities on Ještěd Mountain including hiking, mountain biking, and paragliding. The mountain offers spectacular views and cooler temperatures.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer provides the best weather for mountain activities with long daylight hours and comfortable temperatures.
activities.booking_tips: Take the cable car up and hike down, or book guided activities through local adventure companies.

activities.description: Swim and relax at designated swimming areas around the Harcov Dam reservoir, surrounded by beautiful mountain scenery and walking paths.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer is the only season suitable for swimming in the reservoir, with water temperatures reaching comfortable levels.
activities.booking_tips: Check designated swimming areas and safety conditions. Bring your own towels and refreshments.

activities.booking_tips: Check the festival schedule in advance and arrive early for popular performances.

activities.booking_tips: Visit early morning to avoid heat and see butterflies at their most active. Bring water and comfortable walking shoes.

activities.name: Mountain Biking Trails
activities.description: Explore mountain biking trails around Liberec and the Jizera Mountains, offering various difficulty levels and beautiful summer scenery.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer provides the best conditions for mountain biking with dry trails and pleasant temperatures.
activities.booking_tips: Rent bikes from local shops or bring your own. Check trail conditions and difficulty levels before setting out.

activities.booking_tips: Check the museum's website for current exhibitions and special autumn events.

activities.booking_tips: Combine with a warm meal at Rybářská bašta restaurant to enjoy the autumn atmosphere.

activities.name: Liberec Farmers Market
activities.description: Visit the weekly farmers market for autumn produce, local crafts, and seasonal specialties like fresh apples, mushrooms, and homemade preserves.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn markets feature seasonal produce including apples, pears, mushrooms, and traditional Czech preserves.
activities.booking_tips: Visit early for the best selection of fresh produce and local specialties.

activities.name: Regional Gallery Autumn Collections
activities.description: Explore the Regional Gallery's autumn exhibitions and permanent collections, housed in a beautiful Art Nouveau building.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn is perfect for indoor cultural activities as the weather cools down.
activities.booking_tips: Check for special autumn exhibitions and guided tours. The gallery shop offers unique local crafts.

activities.name: Mushroom Foraging
activities.description: Join guided mushroom foraging tours in the forests around Liberec, learning about local mushroom varieties and traditional Czech mushroom dishes.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn is mushroom season in the Czech Republic, with forests offering abundant varieties of edible mushrooms.
activities.booking_tips: Book guided tours with local experts who can identify safe mushroom varieties. Never forage without proper knowledge.

activities.name: Liberec Autumn Cultural Festival
activities.description: Attend the Liberec Autumn Cultural Festival featuring music, theater, and art exhibitions throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: The festival celebrates autumn culture with indoor and outdoor events as the weather cools.
activities.booking_tips: Check the festival program in advance and book tickets for popular performances.

activities.name: Botanical Garden Autumn Display
activities.description: Visit the Botanical Garden to see autumn flowers and the changing seasons, with the indoor greenhouses providing year-round attractions.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings beautiful fall colors to the garden's outdoor sections, while greenhouses provide warm retreats.
activities.booking_tips: Visit early morning for the best light and fewer crowds. Don't miss the tropical greenhouses.

activities.name: Ještěd Ski Resort
activities.description: Hit the slopes at the Liberec-Rochlice ski resort on Ještěd Mountain, offering various difficulty levels and beautiful mountain views.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter provides the best skiing conditions with natural and artificial snow, typically operating from December to March.
activities.booking_tips: Book ski passes online for discounts. Rent equipment at the base or bring your own. Check snow conditions before visiting.

activities.name: Ještěd Tower Winter Views
activities.description: Visit the iconic Ještěd Tower for spectacular winter views of the snow-covered landscape. The tower offers dining and warm observation areas.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter offers the most dramatic views from the tower, with snow-covered mountains and valleys creating a magical landscape.
activities.booking_tips: Take the cable car up and enjoy warm dining with panoramic views. Book restaurant reservations in advance.

activities.name: Liberec Christmas Markets
activities.description: Experience the magical Christmas markets in Liberec's Old Town Square, featuring traditional Czech crafts, mulled wine (svařák), and festive atmosphere.
activities.seasonal_notes: Christmas markets are a cherished Czech tradition, typically running from late November through December.
activities.booking_tips: Visit in the evening for the best atmosphere with festive lights. Try traditional Czech Christmas treats and mulled wine.

activities.name: Harcov Reservoir Winter Walks
activities.description: Enjoy peaceful winter walks around the frozen Harcov reservoir, surrounded by snow-covered trees and mountain scenery.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter transforms the reservoir into a peaceful snowy landscape, perfect for quiet walks and photography.
activities.booking_tips: Dress warmly and wear appropriate footwear for snowy conditions. The area is beautiful but can be slippery.

activities.name: Liberec Castle Winter Exhibitions
activities.description: Visit Liberec Castle for winter exhibitions and cultural events, offering a warm retreat from the cold weather.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is ideal for indoor cultural activities, and the castle offers a cozy atmosphere with rotating exhibitions.
activities.booking_tips: Check for special winter exhibitions and events. The castle park is beautiful covered in snow.

activities.name: Regional Gallery Winter Collections
activities.description: Explore the Regional Gallery's winter exhibitions and permanent collections in the warm, elegant Art Nouveau building.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter provides the perfect opportunity for indoor art appreciation, with the gallery offering a warm cultural retreat.
activities.booking_tips: Check for special winter exhibitions and guided tours. The gallery is less crowded during winter months.

activities.name: Hot Chocolate at Local Cafés
activities.description: Warm up with traditional Czech hot chocolate and pastries at local cafés like Café Central, enjoying the cozy winter atmosphere.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is perfect for enjoying warm beverages and traditional Czech pastries in cozy café settings.
activities.booking_tips: Visit during off-peak hours to avoid crowds. Try traditional Czech pastries like vánočka (Christmas bread).

activities.name: Liberec Zoo Winter Visit
activities.description: Experience the zoo during winter when many animals are more active in the cooler temperatures, and crowds are smaller.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter offers a unique zoo experience with active animals and beautiful snowy scenery, though some outdoor exhibits may be limited.
activities.booking_tips: Dress warmly and check which exhibits are open during winter months. Indoor tropical pavilions provide warm retreats.
